{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3101743,"name":"","username":"ie67","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-11-20T20:09:17.675Z","cooked":"

My team is using swerve for the first time this year. We got MK4 swerve modules running Falcon 500 motors. Everything is installed and the code works, but the turning motors don’t have the same angle, so it doesn’t go straight when we want it to. I’ve tried changing the zero position for the CANCoders from PheonixTuner, but it doesn’t seem to work. Any suggestions?

I think it would help to see what your code is. Then we can probably advise how to work those offsets in.

In general for our code, we zero out all offsets in code, reset the wheels to zero position. Read the cancoder values and put these values in our offsets.

Hi, I’m using the same code as from here:

github.com

MK3-Swerve-Example/src/main/java/frc/robot at main · ZachOrr/MK3-Swerve-Example

main/src/main/java/frc/robot

Example code for the Swerve Drive Specialties MK3 module

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2022-11-20T20:17:05.448Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":23,"reads":258,"readers_count":257,"score":171.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":418282,"topic_slug":"swerve-offsetting-turn-motors","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/ZachOrr/MK3-Swerve-Example/tree/main/src/main/java/frc/robot","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"MK3-Swerve-Example/src/main/java/frc/robot at main · ZachOrr/MK3-Swerve-Example · GitHub","clicks":18}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":30247,"username":"vargoose84","name":"vargoose84","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vargoose84/{size}/165453_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51188,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"TheFalcons"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-offsetting-turn-motors/418282/3","custom_user_title":"TheFalcons","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3101837,"name":"Nolan Locke","username":"NolanL","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nolanl/{size}/224254_2.png","created_at":"2022-11-21T01:23:13.235Z","cooked":"

In the code, if you haven’t already, you need to put the values from each cancoder on the dashboard and follow the steps here to set the offsets for each module: https://github.com/SwerveDriveSpecialties/swerve-template#setting-up-module-offsets. Another issues I have seen is the gear ratio not being set correctly, and that is probably an issue here as well because this code is for the MK3 module.

This looks like the place where offsets are done for each module, just change the Rotation2d.fromDegrees(0) to whatever number you get after the tuning.

  private SwerveModuleMK3[] modules = new SwerveModuleMK3[] {
    new SwerveModuleMK3(new TalonFX(1), new TalonFX(2), new CANCoder(0), Rotation2d.fromDegrees(0)), // Front Left
    new SwerveModuleMK3(new TalonFX(3), new TalonFX(4), new CANCoder(1), Rotation2d.fromDegrees(0)), // Front Right
    new SwerveModuleMK3(new TalonFX(5), new TalonFX(6), new CANCoder(2), Rotation2d.fromDegrees(0)), // Back Left
    new SwerveModuleMK3(new TalonFX(7), new TalonFX(8), new CANCoder(3), Rotation2d.fromDegrees(0))  // Back Right
  };
